definition[0]: to increase the price of something, so that you sell it for more than you paid for it
example[0]: Compact discs may be marked up as much as 80%.
definition[1]: to write notes or instructions for changes on a piece of writing, music etc
example[1]: I have to mark up the pages and send them back to the printer.
definition[2]: an increase in the price of something, especially from the price a shop pays for something to the price it sells it for
definition[3]: to increase the price of something so that you sell it for more than it cost to produce, or for more than you paid for it
example[3]: Resellers and distributors then marked up the price of the parts when selling them to end-users.
definition[4]: if shares are marked up, their price or value increases
example[4]: The City believes the retailer is set for strong future growth and the shares were marked up 6p to 355p.
